result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demarcus T Ross

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demarcus T Ross appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Demarcus T Ross.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for DPA hearing. For reasons stated, Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Demarcus T Ross appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Demarcus T Ross.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Case in DPA posture. TAD evaluation has been completed. State is preparing an offer to send to Defense. 
Case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demarcus T Ross in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demarcus T Ross appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  State advises Court of possible DPA but defendant still needs a TADD evaluation.  Defense counsel requests additional time to review with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/22/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

ADDRESS INFO for Demarcus T Ross
Current: 808 Johnson St, Hollandale, MS 38748 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2022)
Prior: 8329 West Congress Street # 6, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Demarcus T Ross in court.   Jessica Birmingham, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/20/22 @ 2:30p
